messages: f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:04): hmmm not sure I 100% agree with david. Or more exactly everything which is touching humans with stong implications is indeed political.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:04): The way the issue is framed is more about the use of public "private"/space on the Web.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:05): The Web has challenged a bit these definitions by making things available in the public space.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:05): even if the usage is intended for a few.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:05): it's often where the friction starts

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:07): the comparison for the access ramp for example is not that good. It would be better if it was used for a private company, a restaurant or a shop which are not public space (aka govs) but used by the public
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:07): that makes it slightly different in terms of thinking.

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:09): the last paragraph of the post will put fire on the oil too. Not very clever. Basically it says to the web accessibility community, I know better than you. Usually this kind of comments creates walls

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:10): This was the good part "Sensible choices along this spectrum can vary depending on how the Web is being used; there's a big difference between publishing to an audience of five (that might be larger later, if you happen to succeed) and publishing to an audience already known to be in the millions."

Having to write text alternatives for all those photos or alternatively hide the photos would block the giving

a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (11:28): So it comes back to the telephone, would you restrict 99% people from accessing something just because 1% can't?

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (11:28): [06:16]  &lt a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9> It's bad because it distracts you from the actual issues

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:30): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: Feel free to speak french if you like. It will of course limit your audience to those who understand you. That is (in this case) your choice
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:30): The accessibility issue concerns when people should be bound to a particular choice to serve the needs of a minority

a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (11:31): Commerical nature is a good test because it means the publisher stands to lose something. In b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9's case, the publisher doesn't lose anything from restricting, just everyone else.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:31): e.g. if I had to translate everything I say into French so that a French speaker with little English could follow
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:32): Of course that woud prevent me saying anything at all
